thread.title: Survivors of Tunisia terror attack in honeymoon hell on first trip since massacre
thread.title_full: Survivors of Tunisia terror attack in honeymoon hell on first trip since massacre

author: Lewis Panther
title: Survivors of Tunisia terror attack in honeymoon hell on first trip since massacre
text:
News Survivors of Tunisia terror attack in honeymoon hell on first trip since massacre Saera Wilson and Mathew James had their dream honeymoon in Florida ruined when they found they were locked out of their villa Share Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
A couple who cheated death in the Tunisian terror attack have had their dream honeymoon in Florida ruined. 
Saera Wilson and Mathew James found they were locked out of the villa they had booked to celebrate their first trip abroad since the massacre in which 30 Brits died. 
The couple, who had taken their two children to Florida, even chose a luxury secure-gated holiday home because of their terrifying experience at the hands of an ISIS gunman. 
“I couldn’t believe it was happening to us,” said Saera. “I couldn’t stop crying.” 
They ended up spending a night sleeping on the sofa of a Good Samaritan Brit – who had her own troubles with holiday firm Disney Area Villas. 
Tearful Saera yesterday told how her frantic call to the firm, owned by Kelly Price, was answered by voicemail. 
Eventually Ms Price sent an iMessage saying she was dealing with an emergency and couldn’t help until the morning. 
She contacted them again later but by then the kids were in bed at the Good Samaritan’s. Hero Mathew was wounded in Tunisia (Photo: Sunday Mirror) Lured in - but villas aren't empty Read More If you alert MI5 about someone you suspect is a terrorist, this is what happens next 
The nightmare was the last thing Saera and James needed as they tried to recover from the horror of Sousse where Kalashnikov-toting terrorist Seifeddine Rezgui gunned down 38 ­holidaymakers in June, 2015. 
Mathew, 32, dived in front of Saera as the bullets flew, taking three rounds which have left him in almost constant pain. 
Both suffered serious post traumatic stress disorder and still need frequent counselling. 
They booked the trip to Kissimme near Orlando with Tegan, seven, and Caden, three, after getting married in January. Mathew and Saera on the air ambulance that brought them back to the UK (Photo: Sunday Mirror) Saera and Mathew (Photo: Craig Hibbert) 
The wedding and honeymoon were supposed to help them move on from their trauma. 
Saera, 27, said: “It’s the first time we’ve been away since Tunisia. But there were people already in the villa. I was beside myself. It has broken me and Mat. 
“I even emailed the firm the day before to check everything was OK and was told it was.” 
On the second day the firm sent the ­Cardiff family to one room in a budget hotel. 
On ­Friday, when they still hadn’t got a villa, they contacted the Sunday Mirror. When we told Virgin ­Holidays of the family’s plight they offered them a villa. Tegan outside villa (Photo: Sunday Mirror) Read More Top secret codes and rules of Disney cast members and employees revealed 
Gemma Greening, who took the family in on the first night, had got to her Disney Area Villa to find a For Sale sign and someone staying inside. 
Her party were moved to another villa, but she phoned the sheriff. Gemma said: “We looked on Trip Advisor and found many people double-booked.” 
It now has emerged several British tourists have reported the firm to US police. Chris Beard, of Portsmouth, reported Disney And I – another villa firm linked to Kelly Price – after he found his place occupied by the owners. 
It cost him £1,000 to stay elsewhere. Other fed-up Brits received correspondence from both firms, despite booking with one or the other. 
A Florida police spokesman said yesterday: “We are investigating allegations of fraud, involving Kissimmee properties.” 
The Sunday Mirror tried to contact Price, Disney Area Villas and Disney and I but received no reply. It’s understood Saera’s £750 deposit is being refunded. 
None of the firms have any links with the Walt Disney Co . Like us on Facebook
